Job ID: A2818556

Title: Data Analyst PLM (F/H)
Description:
Créée en 2007, Antaes est une société suisse de conseil en management et technologie classée dans le top 10 des sociétés de conseil en Suisse. Nous comptons plus de 300 ingénieurs expérimentés qui partagent notre passion.




Présents en Suisse, à Singapour, à Hong-Kong et en France, nous accompagnons nos clients suisses, et internationaux en intervenant dans les domaines suivants :




Conseil en organisation et transformation
Ingénierie Industrielle
Management des systèmes d'Information




En rejoignant nos équipes vous découvrirez :




Une équipe dynamique dans un esprit start-up
Un accompagnement humain et un suivi de l’évolution de votre carrière
Des challenges pour contribuer au développement de votre réseau
Des événements : team building, meet-up, workshop, Winter Event
Une entreprise certifiée @HappyAtWork et ayant une politique RSE engagée (médaille d’or Ecovadis2023)







Missions :




Nous recrutons en CDI un Data Analyst PLM F/H afin de rejoindre notre division production dans le cadre d'un projet de grande envergure.




En tant que Data Analyst PLM, vous aurez les responsabilités suivantes :




Mise en œuvre et ajustement de la stratégie de la démarche ADE (Animation Data Excellence) grâce à une connaissance développée de la collecte, de la conservation et de l’interprétation des données
Garantir la maîtrise des structures de données et gérer la qualité et les risques tout au long de leur cycle de vie
Mise en place et maintient de la structure organisationnelle conforme aux prérogatives de la démarche ADE
S’assurer du respect et de l'adaptation des démarches mises en œuvre
Superviser la qualité, la fiabilité et l'accessibilité des données de son Data Domain
Faciliter la compréhension et l'exploitation de la valeur des données, assurer leur gestion et utilisation, et clarifier leur description, documentation et modélisation métier
Contribuer à définir les règles d'accessibilité, de sécurité, de conformité et de confidentialité




Profil :




Diplôme universitaire idéalement dans la gestion de données
Expérience en business analyse et en data analyse (min 4 ans), avec idéalement une part d'animation de groupe de Key-user
Connaissances logiciels: Power-BI, Tableau, SAP, Créo
Connaissances des pratiques du métier d’Industrialisation et du PLM
Compétences en analyse de données, facilité à s'approprier un domaine de data
Bon esprit de synthèse, sens de la communication
Autonomie, sens du service, rigueur
Capacité à travailler en équipe et d'animer un groupe multisites de Key-user
Show more

En tant que Data Analyst PLM, vous aurez les responsabilités suivantes :


  • Mise en œuvre et ajustement de la stratégie de la démarche ADE (Animation Data Excellence) grâce à une connaissance développée de la collecte, de la conservation et de l’interprétation des données
  • Garantir la maîtrise des structures de données et gérer la qualité et les risques tout au long de leur cycle de vie
  • Mise en place et maintient de la structure organisationnelle conforme aux prérogatives de la démarche ADE
  • S’assurer du respect et de l'adaptation des démarches mises en œuvre
  • Superviser la qualité, la fiabilité et l'accessibilité des données de son Data Domain
  • Faciliter la compréhension et l'exploitation de la valeur des données, assurer leur gestion et utilisation, et clarifier leur description, documentation et modélisation métier
  • Contribuer à définir les règles d'accessibilité, de sécurité, de conformité et de confidentialité


Profil :


  • Diplôme universitaire idéalement dans la gestion de données
  • Expérience en business analyse et en data analyse (min 4 ans), avec idéalement une part d'animation de groupe de Key-user
  • Connaissances logiciels: Power-BI, Tableau, SAP, Créo
  • Connaissances des pratiques du métier d’Industrialisation et du PLM
  • Compétences en analyse de données, facilité à s'approprier un domaine de data
  • Bon esprit de synthèse, sens de la communication
  • Autonomie, sens du service, rigueur
  • Capacité à travailler en équipe et d'animer un groupe multisites de Key-user

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
A rewarding Data Analyst position has become available at a leading firm in their field.

Key Responsibilities:

Drive and the manage Data related initiatives working with internal business & technical stakeholders from requirement gathering to delivering key insights
Making data sets useful and meaningful by presenting key information through Reporting and Data visualisation tools
Building creative and interactive dashboards

With a technical background in Data Analysis, you have the following skills:

Profile:

Experienced in designing and implementing Data Reporting & Visualization (Power BI, Tableau) solutions
Data modelling experience
Cloud DWH (Snowflake, Redshift...) experience
Strong SQL skills, Python a plus
ETL experience
Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science or other relevant studies
Fluent in English
Strong team player with good communication skills

Apply for the Data Analyst position if you believe this is your next challenge.

Title: Internship Data Analyst
Description:
Summary

In our Pharmaceutical Development (PHAD) unit, we are dedicated to advancing and applying cutting-edge pharmaceutical technologies to positively impact patients worldwide through the ongoing creation of novel commercial products.

About The Role

We are currently seeking a skilled intern with a background in programming to contribute to the development to create a digital platform to support product design within PHAD.

This role entails automating data processes, integrating data from diverse data sources, and constructing visualizations to support business decisions.

The ideal candidate will be an innovative problem-solver with experience in data integration, automation, and visualization, and possess programming abilities.

We are looking for a student studying data sciences, computer sciences, bioinformatics or a related degree.

Preferred start date: March/ April 2025

Latest start date: May 2025

Duration: 6 months

Please attach a cover letter explaining your motivation for this position and let us know when you are available. Thank you very much.

Key Responsibilities


Utilization of various applications, services, or connectors (e.g., Power Apps) to enable data flow automation.
Develop and implement data integration processes to aggregate data from multiple sources into a unified tool for a comprehensive overview.
Ensure efficient data management and effective analysis/reporting to support business goals.
Application of programming for data visualization to visualize data from multiple sources within a single platform.
Development of digital tools to support activities related to environmental sustainability.


Essential Requirements

Education: Recent graduate (B.Sc./M.Sc.) or enrolled Master Student

Languages: Proficiency in English

Experience/Professional Requirements

Programming skills (e.g. Python):


Knowledge in software for data visualization (e.g. Power Bi, Spotfire etc)
Ability to work in multidisciplinary teams in an international environment, strong communication skills


Desirable Requirements

Programming skills and experience with handling and connecting data pools (e.g. Power App, Alteryx)

Why Novartis: Our purpose is to reimagine medicine to improve and extend people’s lives and our vision is to become the most valued and trusted medicines company in the world. How can we achieve this? With our people. It is our associates that drive us each day to reach our ambitions. Be a part of this mission and join us! Learn more here: https://www.novartis.com/about/strategy/people-and-culture

Commitment To Diversity And Inclusion

Novartis is committed to building an outstanding, inclusive work environment and diverse teams' representative of the patients and communities we serve.

Accessibility and accommodation

Novartis is committed to working with and providing reasonable accommodation to all

individuals. If, because of a medical condition or disability, you need a reasonable

accommodation for any part of the recruitment process, or in order to receive more detailed

information about the essential functions of a position, please send an e-mail to

diversity.inclusion_ch@novartis.com and let us know the nature of your request and your

contact information. Please include the job requisition number in your message

Join our Novartis Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to hear more about Novartis and our career opportunities, join the Novartis Network here: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

Why Novartis: Helping people with disease and their families takes more than innovative science. It takes a community of smart, passionate people like you. Collaborating, supporting and inspiring each other. Combining to achieve breakthroughs that change patients’ lives. Ready to create a brighter future together? https://www.novartis.com/about/strategy/people-and-culture

Join our Novartis Network: Not the right Novartis role for you? Sign up to our talent community to stay connected and learn about suitable career opportunities as soon as they come up: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

Benefits and Rewards: Read our handbook to learn about all the ways we’ll help you thrive personally and professionally: https://www.novartis.com/careers/benefits-rewards

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At JTI we celebrate differences, and everyone truly belongs. 46,000 people from all over the world are continuously building their unique success story with us. 83% of employees feel happy working at JTI.

To make a difference with us, all you need to do is bring your human best.

What will your story be? Apply now!

Learn more jti.com

Data Analyst (m/f/d)

A Data Analyst in Supply Chain leverages data analysis to monitor, evaluate, and improve supply chain processes. The primary goal is to optimize operations, reduce costs, and ensure timely delivery of products. This role is crucial for identifying trends, forecasting demand, and making informed decisions that align with the company’s strategic objectives.

Position

As the Data Analyst in Supply Chain, you will


Gather and analyze data related to shipment times, inventory levels, costs, and supplier performance
Identify inefficiencies and recommend improvements to streamline supply chain processes
Track KPIs and report on supply chain performance to stakeholders
Work with cross-functional teams to address supply chain vulnerabilities and enhance overall efficiency
Create automated reports for stakeholders
Maintain and govern supply chain database


Requirements


Bachelor’s degree (or equivalent) in data science, computer science, statistics or any other related field
One or more years of experience in mining data as a data analyst
Experience with database and model design and segmentation techniques
Technical writing experience in relevant areas, including queries, reports, and presentations
SAP4L knowledge, advanced MS Office package, Power BI, Power platform, Python and MS SQL
Fluency in English, German is a plus


Global applicants are welcome. However, working a minimum of 50% on site (in Dagmersellen) is required.

Are you ready to join us? Build your success story at JTI. Apply now!

Next Steps

After applying, if selected, please anticipate the following within 1-3 weeks of the job posting closure Phone screening with TA > Assessment tests > Interviews > Offer. Each step is eliminatory and may vary by role type.

At JTI, we strive to create a diverse and inclusive work environment. As an equal-opportunity employer, we welcome applicants from all backgrounds. We are committed to providing reasonable adjustments to applicants with special needs. If you require any accommodations, please let the Talent Advisor know during the selection process.

Title: Analyste de données
Description:
🔥 Job description

Pour notre division Production, nous recherchons un Data Analyst PLM (H/F).




🎯 GENERAL DUTIES

En tant que Data Analyst PLM, vous aurez les responsabilités suivantes :

Mise en œuvre et ajustement de la stratégie de la démarche ADE (Animation Data Excellence) grâce à une connaissance développée de la collecte, de la conservation et de l’interprétation des données
Garantir la maîtrise des structures de données et gérer la qualité et les risques tout au long de leur cycle de vie
Mise en place et maintient de la structure organisationnelle conforme aux prérogatives de la démarche ADE
S’assurer du respect et de l'adaptation des démarches mises en œuvre
Superviser la qualité, la fiabilité et l'accessibilité des données de son Data Domain
Faciliter la compréhension et l'exploitation de la valeur des données, assurer leur gestion et utilisation, et clarifier leur description, documentation et modélisation métier
Contribuer à définir les règles d'accessibilité, de sécurité, de conformité et de confidentialité




📃 QUALIFICATIONS:

Diplôme universitaire idéalement dans la gestion de données
Expérience en business analyse et en data analyse (min 4 ans), avec idéalement une part d'animation de groupe de Key-user
Connaissances logiciels: Power-BI, Tableau, SAP, Créo
Connaissances des pratiques du métier d’Industrialisation et du PLM
Compétences en analyse de données, facilité à s'approprier un domaine de data
Bon esprit de synthèse, sens de la communication
Autonomie, sens du service, rigueur
Capacité à travailler en équipe et d'animer un groupe multisites de Key-user

Title: Business Intelligence Consultant
Description:
Who We Are:

Forty2 is a seasoned consulting company with over a decade of professional experience in Financial Services.

Operating globally with a presence in Switzerland, Luxembourg, Portugal and Singapore, we are dedicated to business transformation by enhancing business processes. From Project Management, business analysis and Consulting to Hands-On Development, Forty2's diverse technology skill sets empower our team to assist clients in overcoming challenging situations and delivering client projects on time.




What You'll Do:

The Business Intelligence Specialist role is full-time in the Geneva Area. The main responsibilities will be:

Gather and document the requirements identified by consumers of the MIS reports.
Lead the implementation of the bank’s new MIS solution on Microsoft Azure, incorporating the PowerBI ecosystem (PBI, DAX).
Identify and communicate data requirements for reports to the Data Hub team.
Oversee the monthly and daily data loading processes, proactively addressing potential production issues.
Ensure a strong focus on data quality while promoting excellent service standards.
Demonstrate the ability to comprehend complex management processes and apply effective solutions.
Provide customer support for functional, operational, and technical system-related issues.
Possess strong interpersonal skills and deliver training on Power BI reporting capabilities to the Wealth Management division.







Why You Should Join Us:

Beyond engaging in cutting-edge tech projects, you'll be part of a community comprised of talented, forward-thinking individuals. We don't just work together; we inspire and elevate each other. Our dynamic culture, coupled with thrilling challenges and ambitious aspirations, makes Forty2 an exciting workplace.

If you're ready to turn your coding dreams into reality, apply now and embark on an exhilarating adventure with us. Join our team of dynamic individuals and contribute to shaping the future of technology!




Location

Geneva, Switzerland




Qualifications

Master’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field.
Previous experience in IT implementation projects is mandatory.
Proven experience in Management Information Systems (MIS) within the Banking Wealth Management sector.
Technical skills in PowerBI and SQL will be appreciated.
Mastery of computer software such as MS Office.
Creative, problem solver and team player with great adaptability skills.
Proficiency in French and good English level is required (written and spoken).
We will prioritize citizens residing in Switzerland.




Don't miss this opportunity! Apply today to become a part of something extraordinary. 🚀

Title: Data Analyst (100%)
Description:
Sie werden Mitglied eines dynamischen Teams in der Finanz-Abteilung. Kurze und einfache Kommunikationswege, dank Nähe des Haupt-Auftraggebers, erleichtern unser Alltag. Unser kleines Team ist bestrebt, hochwertige Informationen und Wissen aus dem breiten Datenuniversum der Bank zu erzeugen. Wir erledigen alle Schritte von der Datenbeschaffung bis zur Auswertung. Innovation und Einsatz von moderne Technologien liegt uns am Herzen und KI ist der nächste Schritt.




Ihre Aufgaben

Sie erfassen und dokumentieren die Aufträge und erstellen die technischen Anforderungen, zusammen mit dem Auftraggeber
Sie importieren Daten aus den Quellsysteme und führen Datenanalysen durch
Sie entwickeln Prozeduren im Data Warehouse für die Berechnung von KPI und liefern Berichten
Sie entwickeln Dashboard und dokumentieren Ihre Entwicklungen
Sie automatisieren wiederkehren Aufgaben, Reports oder Prozeduren
Sie prüfen die Datenqualität und Datenintegrität über alle Produkten
Sie arbeiten an Konzepte für neue Produkte und entwickeln KI-Modelle oder setzen KI Werkzeuge ein




Ihr Profil

Sie verfügen über einen Berufs- oder Studienabschluss in Informatik/Wirtschaftsinformatik und können bereits mehrjährige Berufserfahrung im Bereich Data Warehouse/BI eines Finanzdienstleisters vorweisen. Im Umgang mit Excel und mit relationale Datenbanken wie MS SQL Server (oder Oracle) sind Sie bestens vertraut und darüber hinaus verfügen Sie ebenso über gute Programmierkenntnisse (T-SQL). Sie haben bestenfalls Kenntnisse von QlikSense (oder PowerBI). Erfahrungen mit Jedox sowie mit der Bankenplattform Avaloq sind von Vorteil. Ebenfalls sind Erfahrungen mit Python und Data Science Aufgaben vom Vorteil für kommende Projekte. Sie zeichnen sich vor allem durch Ihr analytisches und konzeptionelles Denkvermögen aus und erledigen Ihre Arbeit mit viel Eigeninitiative, selbständig sowie lösungsorientiert. Ein hohes Qualitätsbewusstsein, grosse Lernbereitschaft sowie ein hohes Mass an Verantwortungsbewusstsein setzen wir in dieser Funktion absolut voraus. Fliessendes Deutsch und gute Französisch Kenntnisse (oder umgekehrt) runden Ihr Profil ab.




Unser Angebot

Die Möglichkeit, an innovativen Projekten mitzuwirken und Ihre Ideen einzubringen sowie ein unterstützendes und motiviertes Team, das gemeinsam grosse Ziele erreichen möchte, erwartet Sie. Bei uns wird viel Wert auf die Übernahme von Verantwortung gelegt, hierzu bieten wir viel Spielraum. Eingebettet in den Finanzkonzern der Gruppe Crédit Mutuel bieten wir Ihnen nebst attraktiven Konditionen auch Sicherheit und Kontinuität. Eine sehr gute Vorsorge und Homeoffice-Möglichkeiten sind weitere Pluspunkte.




Stellenantritt per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung.

Show more

Stellenantritt per sofort oder nach Vereinbarung.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
In order to strengthen our Data, Business Intelligence, and AI team, we are recruiting our next :




Senior Data Analyst




As a key member of our Data and BI team, you will play a pivotal role in maintaining ongoing Power BI reports and projects while developing new insights that directly impact the business. Your strong analytical skills, combined with a passion for transforming business requirements into actionable insights, will support multiple departments and contribute to the company's success.




You will ensure a seamless transition of projects from the previous Senior Data Analyst, while continuously evolving our data reporting landscape. You will collaborate closely with various stakeholders across departments, from High Management to Operations, ensuring the accuracy and efficiency of our data processes.




Job responsibilities

Collect, analyze, and interpret large datasets to provide business insights using Power BI.




Ensure the smooth transition of current reports and projects from the existing Senior Data Analyst.
Develop and maintain Power BI reports for departments including High Management, Marketing, Operations, and AFSS.




Create dataflows and semantic models within Power BI to enhance reporting capabilities.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand business objectives and translate them into clear, actionable reporting metrics.




Train and support internal teams in the effective use of Power BI and establish a Power BI users' community.




Work closely with the Data Engineering team to optimize ETL pipelines and data transformation processes within the Microsoft Azure environment.
Stay updated on data analysis tools, techniques, and industry trends to continuously improve the data strategy.




Profile

With a Master’s degree in computer science, data science, business intelligence, or a related field, you possess a strong analytical mindset and a proactive approach to solving complex problems. You excel in communicating technical insights to non-technical stakeholders, helping drive performance across the business.




You bring a wealth of experience with a minimum of 5 years in Business Intelligence, specifically focusing on Power BI. Your expertise in data transformation processes within Power BI (Dataflows, Semantic Models, and access management) is essential to this role. Proficiency in SQL and familiarity with Data Engineering practices, particularly in ETL and pipeline management within the Microsoft Azure ecosystem, are key requirements.




As a Senior Data Analyst, your role is crucial in providing the tools and insights necessary to enhance business performance while contributing to the ongoing evolution of our data-driven strategies.




Fluency in both French and English is mandatory; knowledge of Italian is a plus.

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
Quant Analyst – Trading IT Platform

Commodities

Zug, Switzerland




Our client is a global commodities firm, and their trading branch is looking for a Quantitative Analyst to join their team focused on analytics, backtesting, and trading strategy optimisation. This role is central to the development of bespoke quantitative models and tools that support derivatives structuring, hedging, and trading.




Key Responsibilities:

Develop and implement quantitative models and analytics tools to enhance trading strategies.
Conduct in-depth data analysis and backtesting to support decision-making in derivatives and hedging strategies.
Collaborate with traders and data engineers to integrate advanced analytics into the trading workflow.
Use programming languages like Rust, R, Python, C++ and C# to develop efficient solutions.
Provide insights into market trends, risk factors, and pricing to optimise performance.




Essential Skills & Experience:

Strong foundation in quantitative modelling, data analysis, and financial engineering.
Experience in commodities trading, risk management, or energy markets is highly desirable.
Proficiency in modern programming languages with a focus on Rust, Python, R, C#, and C++(a combination of Rust and R is highly desirable).
Familiarity with trading IT platforms and backtesting frameworks.
Strong communication skills to collaborate effectively with cross-disciplinary teams.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Nous recrutons un ou une Data Analyst pour renforcer le département IT de notre client situé à Genève, Si vous êtes prêt ou prête à relever un nouveau défi, cette offre est pour vous.

Responsabilités:

En tant que Data Analyst vous analysez les données pour un Datawarehouse et définissez les règles métier. De plus, vous effectuez la maintenance du DWH et analysez les données destinées au business. Vous créez des tableaux de bord, des rapports et des visualisation PowerBI. Vous mettez à disposition des Datasets et identifiez les améliorations à apporter. Vous êtes impliquez dans la Data Governance ainsi que dans la maintenance des datas. La veille technologique fait partie de vos tâches.

Profil:


Diplôme en informatique, statistique ou mathématiques
Minimum 5 ans d'experience en tant que Data Analyst ou similaire
Expérience en BI et base de données
Expérience du milieu bancaire obligatoire
Très bonnes connaissances MS SQL Server
Très bonnes connaissances PowerBI
Bonnes connaissances Azure
Français très bon niveau exigé

Title: Junior SQL Developer
Description:
We are in search of a Junior SQL Developer to join our client in Zurich.




In this role, you'll be handle client issues, analyze the SQL database to identify problems, write scripts to fix minor issues, and escalate complex problems to the development team. Over time, you will work more independently.




Fluency in German at a C1 or C2 is essential for this position.




This opportunity is perfect for you if you have 1-2 years of experience in SQL and scripting, ideally in Python, and possess familiarity with PostgreSQL and Linux.




If you are interested in this role, please apply directly to bojana.bandovic@nicollcurtin.com.

Title: Media Intelligence & Analytics Lead
Description:
For our Client in consumer Health industry we are hiring for Media Intelligence & Analytics Lead who will play an instrumental role in driving brand growth in the markets. While being an expert in digital analytics, she/he will be expected to have a good understanding of marketing strategy and planning.




Key Responsibilities-




Gold Standards and digital fundamentals

Follow global guidelines and gold standards to build strong digital fundamentals and support Global to export "fundamentals excellence" in other top markets: website optimization, Social Media, KPIs tracking
Provide digital industry benchmarks to ensure the brand is competitive in the digital space
Identify and expose the marketing team to the newest local digital opportunities, latest technologies, rising trends




Digital Marketing

In close collaboration with the local Marketing team, develop the local media planning and activate consumer-centric digital plans to support equity building and product (re)launches
Manage digital fundamentals to reach Gold Standards: Website Content and SEO, Paid Search, SM presence
Lead the adoption of global programs and the creation of digital activations for seamless execution of omni-channel digital campaigns including owned, paid, social and earned media targeting both Consumers and HCPs
Set up and monitor global digital KPIs ensuring campaign efficiency and long-term effectiveness
Manage local digital agencies Steer continuous optimization and gather learnings and insights




Analytics Management

Day-to-day reporting of marketing efforts for spend, impressions, clicks, leads, and down funnel performance to marry this data to sales and revenue (actual and projections)
Develop detailed, quantitative analysis while developing meaningful insights into business performance for marketing campaigns
Create dashboards, campaign and website performance reports, along with data visualizations for presentations
Monitoring and studying trends in digital media and marketing
Provide variance and impact analyses of lead generation, cost, revenue, and contribution margin
Manage daily and monthly reporting for media buyers and divisional leadership on marketing efforts, performance, and testing
Work with the Digital Director to develop executive reports and insights to help market’s progress
Continually evaluate and recommend possible marketing changes and point out insights to the marketing team that could positively impact the overall marketing/lead generation/optimization strategy
Participate as a thought leader by sharing knowledge and best practices with the entire marketing team, leadership and business unit teams




Qualifications-

University Degree in Digital Marketing or Marketing focus or equivalent
7+ years of hands-on experience in Digital-Ecom in Consumer Health, FMGG industries,
Digital Consulting or Digital agency experience preferred




Knowledge and Skills

E-Commerce Channel Dynamics (marketplaces, e-retailler, online pharmacies, dcommerce…)
Paid media (display, paid search, influencers) and Search engine functioning and tools (i.e., Google Ads, search console, SemRush, UTM/Pixels…)
Website management and analytics (high skills in CMS and GA)
Detailed reporting of output vs outcome KPIs across owned, social, paid and earned
Social media management and analytics platforms
Has a real sense of urgency to deliver
Strong creativity – thinks out of the box.
Externally focused, has presence in meetings, transparent

Title: Quantitative Researcher
Description:
Are you an experienced Quant Engineer with a passion for Systematic Trading? Do you have strong software development skills in Python, R, C# or F#? Are you keen to contribute to the growth of a successful Hedge Fund? If so this could be the perfect Quant Engineer job for you.




You will be joining a close knit team that are responsible for performing Quant analytics for the firm's Portfolio Managers. The team operate in a hybrid technology and Quant capacity given the firm are a Systematic Trading Firm. The core of the role is analysing Options market data to truly understand how a market works and build automated trading strategies around this. So the role will be a blend of developing and improving operational processes by ensuring they are more automated, working as the layer between the technology team and the portfolio managers, performing data analysis of very large data sets and creating trading strategies.




The group has expanded rapidly, which provides numerous technical challenges and the opportunity for a clear career trajectory either deeper in Quantitave Analysis or alternatively into the trading / portfolio management space. This is a unique opportunity to be a key part of a successful Hedge Fund and get to learn from real expert Traders / Portfolio Managers.




The team are hiring multiple levels of experience. Quants with strong programming skills and a keen interest in learning about Trading will be considered and similarly candidates with excellent knowledge of Quantitative Analysis and multiple years of experience will also be considered. What is essential is a good technical background in a programming language such as Python, R, C#, or F#. Excellent numerical and analytical skills, Excel skills and an interest in Options / Systematic Trading.




The firm focus on Options and Volatility trading, as such any interest or experience with Volatility and Equity Derivatives would be highly beneficial - however proven Quant experience in any asset class will be considered, provided you can demonstrate a true enthusiasm to work within the Systematic Trading space.




If you are interested in this Quant Engineer job and want to find out more please send me an updated version of your CV to yves.amar@nicollcurtin.com, if you do not have an updated version of your CV and would like to find out more, then please give me a call on 044 5785 330

Title: SQL Database Engineer
Description:
Senior SQL Server Engineer 80-100%

Startdatum: 03.02.2025

Enddatum: 31.12.2025




Für unseren Kunden in der Versicherungsbranche suchen wir zwei erfahrene Senior SQL Server Spezialisten, um eine bestehende DB-Synchronisierung innerhalb eines Krankenversicherungssystems zu betreiben und zu verwalten.







Hauptaufgaben:




Betrieb und Pflege des Operational Data Storage (ODS), in dem die Daten für unsere zentrale Verwaltungsapplikation (Web) bereitgestellt werden.
Verwaltung und Überwachung von ETL-Strecken und gespeicherten Prozeduren, die die Daten in das ODS laden.
Betrieb und Verwaltung der bestehenden DB-Synchronisierung zu Umsystemen innerhalb eines Krankenversicherungssystems (KV-System).
Umsetzung von fachlichen Anforderungen sowie effektive Lösung von Bugs.
Zusammenarbeit mit funktionsübergreifenden Teams, um einen reibungslosen Datenfluss und Datenumwandlungen sicherzustellen.







Das bringst du mit:




Sehr gute Kenntnisse in SQL und T-SQL
Hervorragendes technisches Verständnis von SQL Server und die Fähigkeit, komplexe Zusammenhänge zu verstehen und Lösungen daraus abzuleiten
Selbstständige Arbeitsweise und ein hohes Mass an Verantwortungsbewusstsein
Idealerweise Kenntnisse im Bereich BVG (Berufliche Vorsorge)
Fliessende Deutschkenntnisse und gute Englischkenntnisse

Title: IT Business Analyst
HTML:
Why Join Us

The Ermenegildo Zegna Group is one of Italy’s most famous family driven enterprises and a world leader in luxury menswear. Founded in 1910, Zegna is deeply grounded in history and craftsmanship, yet always at the forefront of contemporary innovation and style.

We are pioneers who embrace change, take ownership of our actions and work to create the world we want.

With over 500 points of sale and 7,000 employees worldwide, we’re as proud of our people as our products and look for others that share our passion and commitment to excellence and authenticity.

Your Opportunity

Location: Stabio (20% smart working)

As an IT Business Analyst, you will be a member of the Planning and Consolidated application maintenance and development services support team, and you will focus your responsibilities on projects and application maintenance aimed at users located in all areas of the world where the Zegna Group operates.

How Will You Contribute

  • Technical support on Planning and Consolidation applications and resolution of related problems;
  • Implementation of evolutions on systems and/or coordination of supplier activities in the development and evolutionary maintenance phases of application solutions;
  • Drafting of the technical specifications necessary for the evolution and maintenance of the systems;
  • Coordination of supplier activities in the development and evolutionary maintenance phases of application solutions;
  • Support to users in the testing and training phases for the start-up and use of new features and new applications;
  • Technical support for users and resolution of related problems;
  • Management of relationships with internal customers.

Who You Are

You are a professional with strong data analysis and team working skills, with experience understanding business processes and mature project management skills.

You Have

  • Degree in Economics or Engineering or Computer science (or similar);
  • At least 3 years of experience in similar roles in the IT function of structured companies and/or consultancy companies;
  • In-depth knowledge of the SAP BPC system (knowledge of the main EPM tools will be considered a plus);
  • Fluency in spoken and written Italian and English;
  • Willing to travel.

Title: Data Contributor (No experience needed) - One-time Remote Task
Description:
Position: Data Contributor

Project Location: Switzerland (Remote)

Engagement Model: One-time task, task based




We are currently looking for contributors to participate in our Wharf remote project!




What is the project about?

The purpose of this project is to collect text messages, emails, and attachments that you have received for booking confirmations, changes, or cancellations within the past 2 years.




You can submit personal text messages, emails, and attachments in German (Switzerland), French (Switzerland), or Italian (Switzerland) from a variety of categories:

Travel: Flights, Hotels, Car rentals, Ticketed ground transport (e.g., train, bus, ferry);

Entertainment: Tickets for movies, shows, sports and other events, Party invitations originating from event providers;

Appointments: Doctor appointments, dentist appointments, personal care appointments (e.g., oral hygienist, physical therapist, etc.), appointments for family members (e.g., children’s doctor appointments).




Task Description

Using our DataForce proprietary platform, you will share assets (text messages, emails, and attachments) from your personal computer (desktop or laptop) or mobile device, according to the instructions that will be shared with you if you qualify for the project.

You can submit as many assets as you wish for the open categories.

Compensation

You will receive $3.5 USD per each accepted asset, via PayPal, Gift Card or Wire Transfer, according to your preference.




If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at: DataForce.Sourcing@transperfect.com







***

DataForce by TransPerfect is part of the TransPerfect family of companies, the world’s largest provider of language and technology solutions for global business, with offices in more than 100 cities worldwide.

We offer high-quality data for Human-Machine Interaction to some of the most prestigious technology companies in the world. Our division focuses on gathering, enriching and processing data for Machine Learning in different AI domains.

To learn more about DataForce please visit us at https://www.transperfect.com/dataforce

Title: Quantitative Research Analyst
Description:
Calibrium AG is a private Investment Office that invests in a broad range of asset classes globally. We are fundamental long-term investors looking for a highly motivated and analytically minded professional to join our team as a Quantitative Research Analyst (100%). The ideal candidate possesses a practical mindset, excels at applying their skills to real-world challenges, and is adept at developing effective solutions.




You are intensely curious, have a passion for solving complex problems presented by financial markets and a strong willingness to learn and self-educate about new investment opportunities/strategies. You work diligently and have a hands-on approach. You will be reporting to the co-head of the Liquid Investment Division.







Responsibilities

Oversee the codebase, providing quality control, troubleshooting, and support
Execute ad-hoc projects that require both coding expertise and advanced quantitative skills
Support the team’s trade execution activities
Enhance existing asset allocation and portfolio construction models across both liquid and illiquid asset classes
Improve and develop the current return and risk forecasting models and optimize systematic investment strategies
Develop tactical asset allocation models informed by market and macroeconomic signals
Keep abreast of industry and academic research to identify and incorporate relevant innovations







Requirements

University degree in mathematics, statistics, econometrics, quantitative finance, computer science or physics; CFA is a plus
Strong programming skills in Python with the ability to write clear code
Exceptional analytical skills with 3+ years of experience in financial data analysis, alpha research, portfolio construction, back-testing, simulation and building quantitative non-latency sensitive trading strategies
Ability to present complex ideas in an intuitive and easy to follow manner and work in an international team
Demonstrable passion for investing and markets
Excellent command of written and spoken English; German is a plus
Must be resident in Switzerland or willing to relocate







We offer

An environment uniquely dedicated to investing
A culture of open discussion, intellectual honesty and constructive dissent
A platform on which to improve and grow your already significant talents
Responsibility given early
Compensation commensurate with performance







Calibrium provides a challenging and fair work environment in an international team.




We only consider applications which include a motivational letter and CV (no more than 2 pages). Please send your complete application documents to: hr@clbrm.com.

Show more

You work diligently and have a hands-on approach. You will be reporting to the co-head of the Liquid Investment Division.



Responsibilities

  • Oversee the codebase, providing quality control, troubleshooting, and support
  • Execute ad-hoc projects that require both coding expertise and advanced quantitative skills
  • Support the team’s trade execution activities
  • Enhance existing asset allocation and portfolio construction models across both liquid and illiquid asset classes
  • Improve and develop the current return and risk forecasting models and optimize systematic investment strategies
  • Develop tactical asset allocation models informed by market and macroeconomic signals
  • Keep abreast of industry and academic research to identify and incorporate relevant innovations



Requirements

  • University degree in mathematics, statistics, econometrics, quantitative finance, computer science or physics; CFA is a plus
  • Strong programming skills in Python with the ability to write clear code
  • Exceptional analytical skills with 3+ years of experience in financial data analysis, alpha research, portfolio construction, back-testing, simulation and building quantitative non-latency sensitive trading strategies
  • Ability to present complex ideas in an intuitive and easy to follow manner and work in an international team
  • Demonstrable passion for investing and markets
  • Excellent command of written and spoken English; German is a plus
  • Must be resident in Switzerland or willing to relocate



We offer

  • An environment uniquely dedicated to investing
  • A culture of open discussion, intellectual honesty and constructive dissent
  • A platform on which to improve and grow your already significant talents
  • Responsibility given early
  • Compensation commensurate with performance



Calibrium provides a challenging and fair work environment in an international team.


We only consider applications which include a motivational letter and CV (no more than 2 pages). Please send your complete application documents to: hr@clbrm.com.

Title: Data Engineer (m/w/d)
Description:
Für ein Kundenprojekt wird ein erfahrener Data Engineer (m/w/d) gesucht. Gemeinsam mit dem Team werden Sie innovative Lösungen entwickeln, wertvolle Insights aus Daten generieren und Abläufe optimieren.




Eckdaten:

Standort- Zürich
Startdatum- 13.01.2025
Projektdauer- bis 31.12.2025 mit Option auf Verlängerung
Arbeitspensum- 80%-100%
Home-Office- ja, hybrides Arbeiten ist nach Absprache möglich




Ihre Aufgaben:

Sammeln und Transformieren von strukturierten und semi-strukturierten Daten aus verschiedenen Quellen.
Modellierung von Daten mit mathematischen und statistischen Ansätzen sowie Bereitstellung anwendergerechter Visualisierungen.
Erstellung und Analyse von KPIs, um Prozesse kontinuierlich zu verbessern.
Systematische Erarbeitung von Architektur- und Lösungsvarianten basierend auf Stakeholder-Anforderungen.
Weiterentwicklung bestehender und neuer Azure Services.
Enge Zusammenarbeit im interdisziplinären Scrum-Team unter Anwendung von DevOps-Prinzipien.




Profil:

Hochschul- oder Universitätsabschluss in Informatik, Data Science, Elektrotechnik oder vergleichbare Ausbildung.
Mindestens 3 Jahre Erfahrung im Data Engineering.
Fundierte Kenntnisse in SQL, Python und Microsoft Azure, insbesondere mit Data Warehouse/ Data Lake-Architekturen.
Kenntnisse in der Frontend-Entwicklung (Microsoft Power BI, DAX) von Vorteil.
Ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten und ein adaptives Verständnis für komplexe Prozesse.
Selbstständige, zielorientierte Arbeitsweise und Teamfähigkeit.
Verhandlungssichere Deutschkenntnisse (C1) und gute Englischkenntnisse (B2).
Show more

Title: Student (m/f/d) Data Analyst 40%
Description:
At Endress+Hauser, progress happens by working together. As the global leader in measurement instrumentation, our ~17.000 employees shape the future in the field of process automation. Whether developing and realizing new technology as a team, collaborating to build instrumentation, or strengthening vital relationships with countless global industries, we work to create trusted relationships that help everyone thrive. As a family-owned company, we look beyond short-term moves and work to create a vision that is forward-thinking for our people, our clients, and the world at large.   

We are looking for a Student (m/f/d) Data Analyst with 40% workload to join our Group and and contribute to our cross-functional project team. The position is located in Reinach, BL, Switzerland.

What is the role about? 

Are you passionate about data analysis and creating solutions that drive business decisions? Do you enjoy working collaboratively in a dynamic team environment? Are you eager to take on challenges and make an impact through your work? If so, you are the type of person who would excel in our Student (m/f/d) Data Analyst role. Join us in leveraging data to optimize our demand planning processes, contributing to the success of our integrated business planning initiatives.

Which tasks will you perform? 


You will analyze data as a member if the Integrated Business Planning Data Team, contributing to informed decision making
You will autonomously find solutions to given tasks regarding data analysis, demonstrating resourcefulness and initiative
You will develop diagrams to visually represent complex data sets and analysis results
You will interpret and document data analysis results, providing clear insights for stakeholders


What do we expect from you?  


Enrolled student
Advanced statistics knowledge
Experience with business warehouse (bw) and business application programming (bap)
Advanced knowledge of Excel, including SAP Analysis for Microsoft Office Plug-in
Collaborating effectively within cross-functional teams
Knowledge of demand planning and analysis of market-related figures is an advantage


What can you expect from us? 


We are a family-owned, highly committed company with a sustainable vision.
We prioritize Work-Life Balance, offering flexible working hours and remote work opportunities to support our employees in maintaining a healthy balance.
We promote lifelong learning with versatile training and further education opportunities, internal knowledge transfer and e-learning.  


How do you apply?

To apply we kindly ask you to upload your documents on our career page.

Applications sent to us by E-Mail cannot unfortunately be considered due to Data Privacy considerations.

Agencies, HR service providers, or similar entities are kindly requested to refrain from unsolicited submission of profiles and inquiries regarding potential collaboration. Currently, we do not engage with external service providers for this role. Any unsolicited applications will be disregarded and deleted without further consideration. We appreciate your understanding.
Show more

Title: Data & Insights Analyst/Analyste de données et perspectives
HTML:
Data & Insights Analyst


Group: Digital Insights

Reports to: Lead, Data & Insights

Location: WADA Europe Office, Lausanne, Switzerland


Posting deadline: 17 January 2025


WHO WE ARE


The World Anti-Doping Agency (WADA) was established in 1999 as an international independent agency to lead a collaborative worldwide movement for doping-free sport. As the global regulatory body, WADA’s primary role is to develop, harmonize and coordinate anti-doping rules and policies across all sports and countries. Our key activities include: scientific and social science research; education; intelligence & investigations; development of anti-doping capacity; and, monitoring of compliance with the World Anti-Doping Program.


POSITION OVERVIEW


Within, the World Anti-Doping Agency (“WADA”) Digital Insights Impact Area (the “Impact Area”), the Data & Insights Analyst will assist the Lead of the unit in understanding complex key business problems, improving operational performance, and supporting the Agency’s strategic priorities by conducting anti-doping data analysis.


More specifically, the Data & Insights Analyst will effectively analyze, assess, process and monitor data coming from a variety of sources and will disseminate within the Organization strategic and operational insights.


The Data & Insights Analyst will contribute to the development and implementation of a data-led system to assess, identify and report on doping trends, threats and patterns worldwide, for informed decision-making, and strengthen and monitor WADA’s Anti-Doping strategies and operations.


Working under the supervision of the Lead, the Data & Insights Analyst will be an essential member of the WADA’s Digital Insights Unit.


KEY RESPONSIBILITIES


  • Create and maintain rich and user-friendly interactive visualizations and dashboards, with reporting components;
  • Improve the Organization operational performance by automating the data extraction, increasing data quality and integrating data coming from multiple sources;
  • Explore solutions to improve knowledge on doping trends and patterns to feed the Organization anti-doping programs;
  • Contribute to and support various strategic projects and reports for executives, project teams and stakeholders;
  • Proactively analyze data to answer key questions for WADA or their stakeholders;
  • Contribute to the evaluation of the organization’s methods, to the creation of best-practice documents regarding data analysis processes and the development of an internal network of data practitioners;
  • Generate information and insights from data sets and identifying trends and patterns;
  • Develop and deliver useable solutions under ascribed deadlines;
  • Work effectively with a cross-functional team.


QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS


  • Bachelor or Master’s degree (or equivalent) in Applied Statistics and/or Data Analytics or related fields (background in forensic science is an asset), with 3 or more years’ professional experience;
  • Proven experience in the analysis of data for strategic and operational intelligence purposes. Experience in Anti-Doping is a plus;
  • Experience in a similar position is an asset;
  • Proven experience working with dimensional and relational databases, data analysis methodology, BI tools (e.g. Power BI and Tableau) and programming (e.g. SQL, R or Python);
  • Excellent problem solving and analytical skills – the ability to identify trends, patterns, and insights from data;
  • Experience in qualitative and quantitative data analysis is an asset;
  • Highly developed interpersonal and collaborative skills;
  • Strong attention to detail;
  • Ability to work quickly and accurately, with or without supervision, or as part of a cross-functional team and organization, in a structured and organized manner;
  • Strong documentation and presentation skills – ability to write and speak clearly to easily communicate complex ideas in a way that is easy to understand;
  • Excellent oral and written skills in one of the two WADA official languages (English/French) and good command of the other official language. Spanish or other languages would be an asset;
  • Periodic evening and/or weekend work expected;
  • No travel required;
  • Fit with organizational culture: Teamwork, team spirit and love of sport;
  • Aligned with WADA core values: Integrity, Openness and Excellence.


WHAT WE OFFER


  • Working with great colleagues, for a good cause;
  • Retirement plan contribution very competitive;
  • Group Insurance 100% premium covered by WADA (effective first day of employment);
  • Annual wellness subsidy;
  • Professional development and growth opportunities;
  • Hybrid work environment (a mix of office and home-based work);
  • Reimbursement of monthly internet costs (capped amount per month) after probation period.



The masculine is used in our communications for the sole purpose of lightening the text and it designates all genders. WADA believes in the success of an inclusive organization that values diversity within its team. All qualified candidates will be considered for this position in a fair manner. WADA would like to thank all candidates who have shown an interest by applying for a position. However, after a thorough profile review, only the retained candidates will be contacted.


Vision: WADA’s vision is a world where all athletes compete in a doping-free sporting environment.

Mission: WADA's mission is to lead a collaborative worldwide movement for doping-free sport.

About us: WADA is headquartered in Montreal, Canada and has regional offices in Cape Town, South Africa; Lausanne, Switzerland; Montevideo, Uruguay; Tokyo, Japan and the office of the President in Warsaw, Poland. As of March 2024, the Agency employs approximately 181 employees and is represented by 58 nationalities. We value the diversity of our employees – current and future – that, as a global team, endeavor every day to protect the rights of clean athletes worldwide.

Title: Quantitative Researcher, Equity Stat-Arb
Description:
This client is a senior portfolio manager with a long and successful track record at some of the world's top hedge funds at scale. This Manager has recently joined a new large fund in Switzerland and seeks to build a new team. This manager is focused on developing and deploying cutting-edge trading strategies across global markets. This manager 'genuinely' operates at the intersection of finance, data science, and technology, and he is entirely hands-on. Join a team of brilliant minds in a fast-paced, collaborative environment where your contributions will make a real impact.




Role

We seek a talented and driven quantitative alpha researcher with equity statistical arbitrage strategies expertise. The ideal candidate will combine deep market knowledge with advanced quantitative skills to design, backtest, and implement innovative trading models. Proficiency in Python is essential, as you'll work extensively with data-driven research and algorithmic strategy development.




Responsibilities

Develop and refine statistical arbitrage strategies focused on equity markets.
Conduct rigorous data analysis to identify patterns, inefficiencies, and alpha opportunities.
Build and maintain robust backtesting frameworks to evaluate strategy performance.
Collaborate with data engineers to source, clean, and preprocess large datasets.
Optimize strategies for execution, considering market impact, slippage, and risk constraints.
Monitor live strategy performance and adjust as necessary to maintain alpha generation.




Qualifications

Master’s/PhD. in a quantitative field such as Mathematics, Statistics, Probability Theory, Machine Learning, etc
Excellent understanding and experience of equity markets and statistical techniques.
Proven experience in quantitative research and strategy development. 3-7 years of experience.
Proficiency in Python, with experience in libraries such as Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-learn, and PyTorch (or similar).
Solid understanding of machine learning and statistical modeling techniques.
Good understanding of risk management principles and portfolio optimization.
Fluency in verbal and written English.




Offered

Aggressive compensation package, including top-line performance-based bonuses. Full benefits package.
A culture of innovation and collaboration in a supportive team environment.
Access to cutting-edge technology and data resources and significant capital.
Opportunities for professional development and growth. Strong potential to progress to running and managing risk in the future.
Visa and Relocation to Switzerland.
Show more

Title: Business and Data Analyst
Description:
Job description:


Collaborate with business areas to understand their data needs and requirements.
Define requirements for data products in collaboration with business stakeholders.
Design data models that meet business requirements.
Assist in the creation of data workloads such as reports, queries, spreadsheets, and dashboards in the new data lakehouse platform.
Develop and execute test plans to ensure accuracy and completeness.
Write and optimise SQL queries to support the creation and validation of the data workloads.
Document processes, data models, and any changes to business workflows.
Stay current with industry trends and best practices in data management.



Requirements:


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Data Science, or a related field
Solid experience in data projects, ideally within financial services, commercial banking or a similar industry
Deep understanding of business areas such as Middle Office, Risk, or Finance
Proficiency in SQL, with the ability to write and optimise complex queries
Strong experience in data modelling data lakehouse technologies (Snowflake, Iceberg, Databricks)
Familiar with data platforms and modern data architecture principles.



Competences:


Excellent problem-solving skills and attention to detail.
Strong communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to work effectively with cross-functional teams.
Ability to manage multiple tasks and priorities in a fast-paced environmen

Title: Biostatistiker:in / Daten Analyst
Description:
60 %

Veterinary Public Health Institut, DCR-VPH, Vetsuisse-Fakultät, Universität Bern sucht

zum 01.03.2025 oder nach Vereinbarung

Aufgaben

Die Stelle beinhaltet zu ca 50% statistische Beratung von Forschungsprojekten (v.a. klinische Studien und Beobachtungsstudien) an der Vetsuisse Fakultät der Universität Bern, sowie institutsinterne Unterstützung bei fortgeschrittenen statistischen Analysemethoden und Data Science (u.a. Machine Learning). Dabei werden Sie mit verschiedenen Masterstudierenden und Doktorierenden und deren Betreuungspersonen zusammenarbeiten. Die Beratung beinhaltet neben der Unterstützung bei der statistischen Auswertung der Daten auch Fragen im Bereich des Studien Designs, sowie ggf. Mithilfe beim Verfassen von wissenschaftlichen Publikationen.

Zudem werden Sie zu einem kleineren Teil (ca 10%) bei der Lehre mitwirken. Dies beinhaltet Lehre in Biostatistik für Tiermedizin-Studierende, sowie bei Kursen für PhD Studierende der Universität Bern.

Anforderungen


Master in Biostatistik, Epidemiologie oder einer naturwissenschaftlichen Disziplin
Sehr gute Statistikkenntnisse und Erfahrung mit statistischen Softwares (R, Python, STATA, NCSS)
Erfahrung in wissenschaftlichen Publikationen von Vorteil
Ausgeprägte Kundenorientierung und Verhandlungsgeschick
Didaktische Ausbildung und Lehrerfahrung von Vorteil
Fähigkeit, technische Begriffe an Laien verständlich zu vermitteln
Belastbarkeit und die Fähigkeit, viele Projekte parallel zu bearbeiten


Wir bieten

Wir bieten ein aktives wissenschaftliches Umfeld in einem veterinärepidemiologischen Forschungsinstitut mit rund 15 Personen. Zu den Forschungsschwerpunkten des VPHI gehören angewandte Forschung zur Modellierung von Infektionskrankheiten, die Überwachung und Kontrolle der Tiergesundheit und von Zoonosen, Tiergesundheitsökonomie, sowie One Health. Das Institut bietet eine offene Team-Kultur mit vielen Interaktionen zwischen den Forschungsprojekten.

Die Stelle ist sehr abwechlungsreich in Bezug auf die zu betreuenden Forschungsprojekte, sowie in der zwischenmenschlichen Zusammenarbeit.

Die Entlöhnung erfolgt nach universitären Richtlinien.

Die Stelle ist auf 2 Jahre befristet mit der Option auf Festanstellung.

Bewerbung und Kontakt

Für fachliche Auskünfte zur Stelle steht Ihnen Frau Salome Dürr (salome.duerr@unibe.ch oder 031 684 5739) oder Herr Ioannis Magouras (ioannis.magouras@unibe.ch oder 031 684 5744) zur Verfügung

Ihre Bewerbung mit den üblichen Unterlagen senden Sie bitte

elektronisch

bis am


Januar 2025


an salome.duerr@unibe.ch.

www.karriere.unibe.ch Rechtliche Hinweise

Jetzt bewerben

Title: Junior Business Intelligence Developer
Description:
Excellente opportunité long terme au sein d’une société suisse de premier rang.




Pour renforcer une équipe existante nous recherchons un/e




Junior Data Intelligence Developer




Vos activités quotidiennes couvriront les aspects suivants :

Concevoir, développer, tester et intégrer de solutions BI / DI
Assurer le développement d’évolutions des applications existantes
Assurer le support et la gestion des incidents des applications dont vous aurez la charge




Pour mener à bien vos activés vous mettrez à contribution votre maitrise du langage SQL sur DB Oracle, et vos bonnes connaissances des concepts de Business Intelligence et Data Intelligence (environnements analytiques, tableaux de bord, rapports opérationnels, interfaces de données, etc).

Une expérience d’au moins 2 ans dans une activité similaire est requise.




Pour en savoir plus sur l'activité, son contexte, contactez-nous directement ! Nous vous répondrons avec plaisir !

Show more
HTML:
Excellente opportunité long terme au sein d’une société suisse de premier rang.


Pour renforcer une équipe existante nous recherchons un/e


Junior Data Intelligence Developer


Vos activités quotidiennes couvriront les aspects suivants :

  • Concevoir, développer, tester et intégrer de solutions BI / DI
  • Assurer le développement d’évolutions des applications existantes
  • Assurer le support et la gestion des incidents des applications dont vous aurez la charge


Pour mener à bien vos activés vous mettrez à contribution votre maitrise du langage SQL sur DB Oracle, et vos bonnes connaissances des concepts de Business Intelligence et Data Intelligence (environnements analytiques, tableaux de bord, rapports opérationnels, interfaces de données, etc).

Une expérience d’au moins 2 ans dans une activité similaire est requise.


Pour en savoir plus sur l'activité, son contexte, contactez-nous directement ! Nous vous répondrons avec plaisir !

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
📢 Offre d’emploi : Data Engineer (Suisse)




Nous recherchons un Data Engineer pour rejoindre une équipe dédiée à la conception, au développement et à la maintenance de solutions sur mesure dans le domaine des données.




🖊️Vos principales responsabilités :

Comprendre, soutenir et améliorer les pipelines de données existants.
Concevoir et développer de nouveaux pipelines pour répondre aux besoins croissants.
Moderniser la plateforme de données en adoptant des technologies modernes et natives du cloud.
Intégrer et gérer diverses sources de données internes et externes.
Assurer la qualité des données via des processus de validation et de vérification.
Fournir une infrastructure pour l’ingestion, le stockage et le traitement des données.
Gérer les versions des nouvelles fonctionnalités tout en garantissant la stabilité de la production.
Automatiser, orchestrer et surveiller les pipelines de données, et intervenir en cas d’alerte.
Préparer des modèles pour la distribution des données aux parties prenantes.




🔍Profil recherché :

🎓 Diplôme universitaire en informatique ou dans un domaine connexe, ou qualification équivalente.
Expérience avérée en ingénierie des données.
Excellente maîtrise de SQL et expérience avec Informatica PowerCenter pour la gestion des pipelines de données sur site.
Compétences solides en Python, avec des bibliothèques telles que Pandas et dbt.
Expérience avec les services cloud, en particulier AWS, et familiarité avec Terraform.
Une expérience dans les entrepôts de données cloud et/ou la virtualisation des données est un atout.
Familiarité avec Microsoft Fabric et Power BI (un plus).
Connaissance des processus de développement logiciel modernes (Jira, Git, CI/CD).
Bonne maîtrise de la modélisation des données pour l’analyse (schéma étoilé) et la distribution via des API REST.
Connaissance de base des produits financiers.
Excellentes compétences interpersonnelles et de communication.
Maîtrise du français et de l’anglais, à l’oral comme à l’écrit.




Pourquoi nous rejoindre ?

🚀 Rejoignez une organisation dynamique et tournée vers l’avenir, où vos compétences contribueront à des projets innovants. Nous valorisons l’esprit d’équipe, l’expertise technique et la passion pour les solutions de données.

Show more

Title: Digital Analytics Consultant - Geneva (H/F)
Description:
fifty-five is a new kind of data company that helps brands transform with data and AI to improve their marketing operations through a combination of specialized consultancy and technology services.

As the strategic data pillar of The Brandtech Group, we offer services that combine strategy consulting, cloud services, media consulting and customer experience.

We are made up of over +400 digital experts. Digital consultants, tracking and media specialists, engineers and data scientists all work in close collaboration to provide senior-level marketing consultancy and technical support to our clients, in every type of industry, all around the world.

As a partner to advertisers from data collection to activation and exploitation, we help organizations become truly omnichannel entities that control the efficiency of their digital ecosystem and its synergies with the physical world.

Headquartered in Paris, we operate across 3 time zones from our 10 offices, located in Paris, London, Geneva, Milan, Shanghai, Hong Kong, Shenzhen, Taipei, Singapore and New York. fifty-five attaches particular importance to the well-being of its employees, which enabled it to be included in the Best Workplaces France ranking in 2018.

Within the consulting team based in Geneva, you will actively take part in delivering fifty-five's data-led projects to multiple clients. Those projects will be driven by client objectives relating to data collection, customer acquisition, onsite conversion optimisation, media-mix optimisation and digital business consulting. During these projects, you will contribute to promoting a customer-centred vision of digital marketing, based on the systematic and methodical use of data to support decisions. You will work across multiple industries including luxury, FMCG, sport, and beauty.


You will report to a Local Executive Director and will work closely with Product, Engineering and Operations Teams based in Paris. As a data analyst and consultant, you will follow an action plan, issuing step-by-step the deliverables required for successful delivery of the project. You will guarantee the integrity of analytics data as well as its analysis and interpretation in working with your team and client.


You will be responsible for the content, the format and overall quality of the outputs delivered to the client and for monitoring their operational and technical implementation where required. Based on your good understanding of our projects and our clients' needs, you will collaborate with all our teams to develop fifty-five's offer, both in terms of marketing and in terms of technical and operational delivery.



Responsibilities

Deliver projects related to the monitoring of the client's digital activity based on key performance indicators (reporting), to onsite conversion optimization through data analysis and webtesting, to online media buy optimization and CRM.
Analyse data and structure relevant information for the client's benefit, in consistency with business indicators specific to their industry (eg. mobile operators, retail, travel, etc.)
Develop a sharp operational expertise on both conversion and online media-buy topics
Meet clients' needs and pay strong attention to the quality of all deliverables
Occasional travel possible, within Switzerland or abroad (including Paris)



Education and Experience

Master's degree (business, engineering) or equivalent diploma
Experience in digital marketing, consulting firms, marketing or business intelligence software, or media agencies
Working with web analytics tools
Knowledge of the main online acquisition channels: SEO, SEM and bidmanagement, display and programmatic, affiliates, email and social media


Skills and Interests

Fluent in French & English and excellent communication, oral and written
Strong analytical skills and knowledge of analysis, statistical software and data vizualization tool
Good business and market understanding
Client-facing skills
Good team spirit
Strong interest in new technologies and the digital industry


55 provides equal employment opportunities to all employees and applicants for employment and prohibits discrimination and harassment of any type without regard to race, color, religion, age, sex, national origin, disability status, genetics, protected veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state or local laws. This policy applies to all terms and conditions of employment, including recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion.

Title: Data Engineer (h/f)
Description:
🔎 Qui est Redsen ?

Cabinet de conseil spécialisé en management et en technologie, crée en 2010, basé à Genève et Morges, c’est avant tout 150 consultants qui interviennent sur des projets de transformations des SI en intervenant principalement sur :

La performance des organisations
La stratégie numérique
Gouvernance du Système d'Information
Transformation et performance de la DSI




Depuis 2021, nous sommes certifiés B Corp et prenons ainsi part au mouvement des entreprises à impact positif !




Dans le cadre de notre croissance, nous recherchons un Data Engineer pour renforcer nos équipes.




Vous aurez pour missions :

De concevoir et réaliser des produits de données
De gérer les évolutions (nouvelles requêtes ou amélioration)
De travailler en lien avec l’architecture d’entreprise, les équipes d’intégration et d’infrastructure afin de garantir un design cohérent et un opérationnel stable
D'élaborer et maintenir la documentation
De participer aux séances agiles




Votre profil :




Vous êtes diplômé(e) d'études supérieures (HES/Master/école d’ingénieurs ou équivalent) et vous justifiez d’au moins 5 ans d’expérience en tant que Data Engineer.




Vous avez les compétences techniques suivantes :




Outils DevOps Gitlab, VSCode, Docker
Outils de tests PyTest / UnitTest, SonarQube, Postman
Outils de transformations DBT, Python, Debezium, autres ETL
Data Sources Parquet sur S3, PostgreSQL, DuckDB, ArangoDB, REST (OpenAPI), GraphQL, XML, Kafka, SQLServer, SGBD Time Series (Prometheus, InfluxDB), ELK
Ordonnancement, monitoring Prefect
Français langue maternelle (ou C1 min) et anglais B2 min




Proactif(ve), autonome et doté(e) d’un fort esprit d’équipe, vous alliez sens de la communication, aisance relationnelle et capacité à résoudre efficacement les problèmes. Vous aimez transmettre et favoriser la transmission des compétences.







Ce que nous proposons :

Type de contrat : CDI

Date de début : entre février et avril 2025

Localisation : Genève ou Lausanne avec déplacements sur les 2 cantons, résidence en Suisse un gros plus (au plus tard au démarrage du contrat)

Télétravail : selon les clients et les règles en vigueur pour les frontaliers







🤜🤛 Pourquoi choisir Redsen Suisse ?

Un cabinet indépendant, à taille humaine avec 150 consultants, avec un portefeuille clients varié
Un plan de carrière personnalisé : nous mettons un point d’honneur à accompagner nos collaborateurs dans leur évolution en offrant un parcours d’intégration personnalisé, un management de proximité et un large catalogue de certifications et de formations
Une ambiance de travail conviviale et chaleureuse ! Vous aurez la possibilité de participer à de nombreux événements organisés tout au long de l’année tels que des afterworks, des soirées d’entreprise ou weekend ski
Enfin, nous rejoindre c’est intégrer une entreprise engagée pour un avenir durable. Nous sommes fiers d’être le premier cabinet de conseil suisse certifié BCorp, une certification décernée aux entreprises qui répondent à des normes élevées de performances sociales et environnementales, de transparence et de responsabilité




Vous souhaitez prendre part à l’aventure Redsen ? Nous attendons votre candidature avec impatience ! 🙂

Title: Data Contributor (No experience needed) - One-time Remote Task
Description:
Position: Data Contributor

Project Location: Switzerland (Remote)

Engagement Model: One-time task, task based




We are currently looking for contributors to participate in our Wharf remote project!




What is the project about?

The purpose of this project is to collect text messages, emails, and attachments that you have received for booking confirmations, changes, or cancellations within the past 2 years.




You can submit personal text messages, emails, and attachments in German (Switzerland), French (Switzerland), or Italian (Switzerland) from a variety of categories:

Travel: Flights, Hotels, Car rentals, Ticketed ground transport (e.g., train, bus, ferry);

Entertainment: Tickets for movies, shows, sports and other events, Party invitations originating from event providers;

Appointments: Doctor appointments, dentist appointments, personal care appointments (e.g., oral hygienist, physical therapist, etc.), appointments for family members (e.g., children’s doctor appointments).




Task Description

Using our DataForce proprietary platform, you will share assets (text messages, emails, and attachments) from your personal computer (desktop or laptop) or mobile device, according to the instructions that will be shared with you if you qualify for the project.

You can submit as many assets as you wish for the open categories.

Compensation

You will receive $3.5 USD per each accepted asset, via PayPal, Gift Card or Wire Transfer, according to your preference.




If you have any questions or concerns, please don't hesitate to reach out to us at: DataForce.Sourcing@transperfect.com







***

DataForce by TransPerfect is part of the TransPerfect family of companies, the world’s largest provider of language and technology solutions for global business, with offices in more than 100 cities worldwide.

We offer high-quality data for Human-Machine Interaction to some of the most prestigious technology companies in the world. Our division focuses on gathering, enriching and processing data for Machine Learning in different AI domains.

To learn more about DataForce please visit us at https://www.transperfect.com/dataforce

Title: Quantitative Analyst
Description:
What It's About

Join Portfolio Solutions at Partners Group. We are the leading portfolio management & quantitative group within private markets, operating across all asset classes. We design and actively manage USD 45bn Evergreens, USD 60bn segregated mandates and 45bn of flagships funds.

We are the quantitative experts in the firm taking responsibility for the high risk and high complexity areas. Beside the numerous quantitative portfolio management aspects, these complex areas include various corporate responsibilities, investment management for our balance sheet, corporate steering tools and pricing.

Responsibilities

We are looking to add a professional to the Quantitative and Risk Management unit in Zug. You will be part of the Corporate Risk and Pricing team and have the following responsibilities:


Develop pricing strategies for customized private equity, private debt, private real estate and private infrastructure mandates
Measure and prepare analytics of Partners Group’s fundraising efforts
Developing proprietary private markets quantitative systems and models (python based)
Performing regular and ad-hoc scenario analysis of private markets data (python, SQL and Excel)
Preparing submissions and presentations for firm-wide management and committees
Operating and enhancing firm-wide private markets models and systems
Providing reporting and analysis for internal and external stakeholders


What We Expect


University degree, with emphasis on Finance, Mathematics, Physics or similar quantitative background
Prior experience in quantitative areas of public or private markets is considered an advantage
Ability to generate original ideas and develop new models or processes based on them
Passion for numbers and quantitative analysis
Strong quality excellence and ability to work error-free
Interest in the international financial industry’s mechanisms
Prior experience in computer programming (Python/SQL) and Excel is considered an advantage
Excellent oral and written communication skills (English)
Professional qualification (e.g. CFA, FRM) desirable but not a requirement


What We Offer

Partners Group is a global financial institution that retains the culture, pace and agility of a start-up. As a growing firm, we are committed to attracting, developing and retaining the very best talent, by offering a workplace where results are truly recognized and rewarded. We offer a fantastic opportunity for you to grow:


Professional, international working environment
Challenging, rewarding career within a growing company
Collaborative environment, with on-the-job training and mentorship opportunities
One-month sabbatical after every five years of service
Education assistance program
Fun office and team events, including volunteer opportunities to connect with and help our local communities


www.partnersgroup.com

Please be aware, fraudsters may pose as Partners Group recruiters. All g enuine representatives can be identified by a verified sign on their LinkedIn profiles. If you suspect fraud or have doubts, contact us immediately at hr@partnersgroup.com

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Data Engineer

Trading IT Platform

Commodities

Zug, Switzerland




Our client is a global commodities firm, and their trading branch is looking for a Data Engineer to play a pivotal role in advancing the infrastructure and data capabilities of our global trading IT platform. This position focuses on developing scalable data pipelines, middleware solutions, and tools to support analytics, backtesting, and trading operations.




Key Responsibilities:

Design, build, and maintain data pipelines and middleware systems for trading IT platforms.
Develop solutions for data integration, transformation, and optimization to support advanced analytics.
Collaborate with quants, analysts, and traders to ensure seamless access to reliable and actionable data.
Work with programming languages such as Rust, Python, C++, C#, and R to develop high-performance systems.
Enhance data infrastructure to improve efficiency, scalability, and decision-making processes.




Essential Skills & Experience:

Strong experience in data engineering, including database management and large-scale data processing.
Proficiency in modern programming languages, with an emphasis on Rust and Python.
Experience in building robust infrastructure for analytics and trading systems.
Familiarity with commodities trading, risk management, or derivatives platforms is a plus.
Strong problem-solving and communication skills to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.

Show more
